Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the same coordinate system, which includes a 3D rotation defined by the Euler angles and a translation vector. Extrude the 3D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 3D sketch along the normal vector by a depth of 0.45 units, resulting in the final shape of part 1. This shape is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section, featuring a rounded corner on one side. The length, width, and height of part 1 are 0.75, 0.45, and 0.75 units, respectively, while the final shape has the same dimensions.</description>
